body: Do we have a guide for `"header"` being internal and `<header>` being external? It always seemed arbitrary to me :D From a C++ point of view, `"path/to/header"` means relative to the current file and `<path/to/header>` means relative to one of the include directories. Since we use absolute paths for all headers the angle brackets are more correct, but it's more of a stylistic issue than anything else

Since we use absolute paths for all headers the angle brackets are more correct, but it's more of a stylistic issue than anything else
